revised_title: Airborne Radar Technique for Investigating and Controlling Migrating Pest Insects
tldr: Researchers developed an airborne radar technique to study the behavior and control of migrating pest insects, such as the spruce budworm moth. The radar system allowed them to detect and track insect density, height, and orientation during flight. This technique helped them understand how weather systems, like sea breezes, affect insect migration and distribution, which can aid in controlling pest populations.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Atmospheric Science
